channel.title: Testing out of Java
channel.description:
So today I decided to test out of Java Programming 1. Been working with it since late 2006, and was confident that I would pass without an trouble. And then I reached this question.
Which of the following is the correct way to override method toString in class Object:
[ol][li]public String toString(String s)[/li] [li]public String to String()[/li] [li]public void toString(String s)[/li] [li]public static String toString(String s)[/li][/ol]
I think the test-creators should learn a bit more about the language before writing the test...
I chose option 2 because toString in Object takes no arguments, and assumed that the space was a mistake.

item.title: Testing out of Java
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:5, topic:396416”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=493585.msg3609487#msg3609487 date=1306435834]
public String toString() ?
[/quote]

Yes, that’s the correct answer, but it wasn’t an option. The only options I had were the 4 I posted. So I went on a mini rant on the front page of the test saying that they should learn a bit about the language before giving a test on it.[/quote]
Oh I see, I didn’t read the answers carefully.

Read full topic

item.title: Testing out of Java
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Reminds me of a harry potter trivia test I took once(no haters!) and like they had 3/10 answers incorrect even though should had been correct…I mean in the first movie Harry had blue eyes instead of green and Luna has blonde hair.

item.title: Testing out of Java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

So today I decided to test out of Java Programming 1. Been working with it since late 2006, and was confident that I would pass without an trouble. And then I reached this question.

Which of the following is the correct way to override method toString in class Object:

[ol][li]public String toString(String s)[/li]
[li]public String to String()[/li]
[li]public void toString(String s)[/li]
[li]public static String toString(String s)[/li][/ol]

I think the test-creators should learn a bit more about the language before writing the test…

I chose option 2 because toString in Object takes no arguments, and assumed that the space was a mistake.
